results.title: Diagnosis and planning adjustment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”.
A dramatization of an incident showing a counsellor’s diagnosis and treatment of a maladjusted student’s emotional problem is used in explaining the role of the counsellor in the over-all school program. Describes the steps in successful counselling - determining the cause of the problem, easing the student’s anxieties and strain, planning courses of action, and assisting the student in making new adjustments.

results.title: Using analytical tools
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Text-Films and University of Minnesota
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”
Illustrates how a trained student counsellor prepared for his interview with an average 16-year-old boy. Discusses the value of analytical tools - such as the student’s cumularive record, his aptitude tests, his anecdotal record and his auto-biography - in identifying and analysing problems.

results.title: The Counselor's day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”.
Dramatises typical activities of a student counselor in a school program and shows the planning and research which are necessary in understanding the student and his problem. Discusses the background and training of a good counselor; emphasises the value of counseling courses, talks to business and civil groups, professional writing, and teaching experiences in youth organisations and hobby clubs.

results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Couchman hosts a studio discussion on schizophrenia among an audience of medical professionals, schizophrenics and others possessing a direct experience of the condition.

results.title: Tattoos
results.creator_credit: Mark Bayly and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Peter Couchman hosts a studio discussion on tattoos and why people wear them. He leads a debate on whether tattoos should be recognised as a legitimate art form. The audience is shown a tattoo being applied during the debate.

results.title: Couchman on customer service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Couchman addresses the issue of the quality of customer service and asks how are we to survive in the competitive and cut-throat nineties. Examples of good and bad customer service are shown in a discussion about the tactics for enduring the recession.

results.title: Media intrusion into grief
results.creator_credit: Mark Bayly and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Peter Couchman compares a discussion with a group of people from all walks of life, about how “The Media” conduct themselves in reporting death and an individuals grief. Do they intrude where they are not wanted? Are they compassionate or just greedy for a sensational story?
